parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To remain by, abide with; met: I persevere in. From para and meno; to stay near, i.e. Remain.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pass the winter. From para and cheimazo; to winter near, i.e. Stay with over the rainy season.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Where, whither, when, in what place. Genitive case of hos as adverb; at which place, i.e. Where.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
